Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2018 03:33PM Minetta57 wrote: Hi, I also have been diagnosed with triple negative recently. As member mentioned above, there is much stuff out there that makes one nervous so I’m not reading that. Today, had my PET scan and echocardiogram. I’m also starting to watch my diet by adding more fruits and veggies and eating less sugar. Although, I have lost a few pounds after this dx. Good luck to you and me.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative- Good or Bad News JoyMrt5 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2018 09:31PM Minetta57 wrote: Hello friends, hope your all doing good. I was called back to my Imaging Center for spot compression views and left breast ultrasound for a nodular density. However, the radiologist on 4/2, found a spiculated mass. She told me it must come out. I see the surgeon on Monday 4/9/18 for consultation. I hope she will do the biopsy any day soon after the consult. I asked the radiologist, what about the nodular density the first radiologist had seen? She said that may be a satellite lesion, and that they want to do an MRI after the biopsy of the spiculated mass and we can see everything after the MRI. I’m very nervous and hanging in there. Jjust moved to Florida in the Fall. Recently lived in CT my whole life. I’m 56. In 1999, had a benign lesion removed in CT. I had a benign microcalcification around 2006. Had mammo every year for the past 15 years in Connecticut. I read few stories here and I wish you all the best. Now, waiting is hard but I’ll keep busy with things. Will talk to you all soon. Sorry I’m longwinded. But I feel better after writing this. Take good care.

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2018 03:24AM Minetta57 wrote: Hi, I’m also a birads5. It is good that they are moving quickly. I had my ultrasound guided biopsy leftyesterday 4/9/18. Tomorrow will be nerve wrecking for me, b/c it’s 2-3 days for pathology results. If this means anything, the biopsy did not hurt. Under ultrasound guidance. It’s a spiculated mass. I hope things work out well for you. I’m trying not to worry. These days there is so much more that can be done. I’m in my mid 50s also. They also plan on an MRI for me as well. Stay on top of things is important.
